patterns: can you give a definition of supply chain
responses: A firm's supply chain can be thought of as all the sequential activities that the company and its suppliers (and manufacturers) undertake in the goods manufacturing process, from production to final distribution.

patterns: what is the supply chain management
can you give a definition of supply chain management
explain me the supply chain management
responses: Supply chain management is the management of the flow of goods and services and includes all processes that transform raw materials into final products. It involves the active streamlining of a business's supply-side activities to maximize customer value and gain a competitive advantage in the marketplace.
the management of the flow of good and services and includes all processes that transform raw materials into final products
Supply chain management (SCM) represents an effort by suppliers to develop and implement supply chains that are as efficient and economical as possible.
Supply chains cover everything from production to product development to the information systems needed to direct these undertakings.

Typically, SCM attempts to centrally control or link the production, shipment, and distribution of a product. By managing the supply chain, companies can cut excess costs and deliver products to the consumer faster. This is done by keeping tighter control of internal inventories, internal production, distribution, sales, and the inventories of company vendors.

patterns: what are the part of SCM
responses:
plannig 
 sourcing 
 manufacturin 
 delevering 
 Returnin

patterns: what is the first part of Supply chain management
responses:
plannig 
 To get the best results from SCM, the process usually begins with planning to match supply with customer and manufacturing demands. Firms must predict what their future needs will be and act accordingly. This relates to raw materials needed during each stage of manufacturing, equipment capacity and limitations, and staffing needs along the SCM process.

patterns: what is the seconde part of SCM
responses:
sourcing 
  Sourcing entails working with vendors to supply the raw materials needed throughout the manufacturing process. A company may be able to plan and work with a supplier to source goods in advance. However, different industries will have different sourcing requirements.

patterns: what is the third part of SCM
responses:
manufacturing 
 At the heart of the supply chain management process, the company transforms raw materials by using machinery, labor, or other external forces to make something new. This final product is the ultimate goal of the manufacturing process, though it is not the final stage of supply chain management.

patterns: what is the fourth part of SCM
responses:
delevering 
 Once products are made and sales are finalized, a company must get the products into the hands of its customers. The distribution process is often seen as a brand image contributor, as up until this point, the customer has not yet interacted with the product. In strong SCM processes, a company has robust logistic capabilities and delivery channels to ensure timely, safe, and inexpensive delivery of products.

patterns: what is the fifth part of SCM
responses:
Returning 
 The supply chain management process concludes with support for the product and customer returns. Its bad enough that a customer needs to return a product, and its even worse if its due to an error on the company's part. This return process is often called reverse logistics, and the company must ensure it has the capabilities to receive returned products and correctly assign refunds for returns received. Whether a company is performing a product recall or a customer is simply not satisfied with the product, the transaction with the customer must be remedied.

patterns: what  are the elements of Supply Chain Models
responses:
external suppliers organizations that provide goods, parts of a product or services.
 internal functions and procedures the company's internal functions and procedures for produce a product 
 responsible for transportation and delivery.the delivery of finished products from the producer or manufacturer to retailers

patterns: what is the importance of supply chain
responses: Supply chain management is important because it can help achieve several business objectives.
controlling manufacturing processes can improve product quality, reducing the risk of recalls and lawsuits while helping to build a strong consumer brand.
controls over shipping procedures can improve customer service by avoiding costly shortages or periods of inventory oversupply.
supply chain management provides several opportunities for companies to improve their profit margins and is especially important for companies with large and international operations.

Supply chains have existed since ancient times, beginning with the very first product or service created and sold. With the advent of industrialization, SCM has become more sophisticated, allowing businesses to be more efficient in terms of producing and delivering goods and services.

patterns: you can give an idea about SCM tools
responses:
Warehouse Management System 
 Transport Management System 
 systÃ¨me de planification avancee

patterns: what about the Warehouse Management System
responses: le WMS is software for controlling and managing the day-to-day operations of a warehouse. It is with this software that we track goods entering and leaving the warehouse. Thanks to it, it is possible to follow the path of each product: received, stored, prepared, packed, shipped. When a customer submits an order, the software knows if the item is in stock and can mark that order as ready to pack.

patterns: te role of Warehouse Management System
responses:
reduce expenses by avoiding a large number of unnecessarily stocked products 
 prevent stock-outs 
 prevent stock-outs

patterns: what about the Transport Management System
responses: Transport is the last step before the end customer, and therefore a decisive step for customer satisfaction. For this, companies must adopt a software solution, called TMS (Transport Management System) to help manage transport flows.

patterns: te role of Transport Management System
responses:
receipt of products 
 stock management 
 preparation of orders 
 shipment of goods.

An APS (Advanced Planning System), which is translated into French as advanced planning system, is software with a supply and production planning functionality. it allows companies to adapt to supply and demand. The APS takes into account a large amount of purchasing, production, storage, distribution and transport data so that companies can adapt the supply chain to customer demand.It is also a decision support tool introduction of new products, removal of products that are no longer sold.

CRM is the acronym for Customer Relationship Management (also called GRC, for Customer Relationship Management) is a software focused on customer relationship management.This tool is made up of a set of systems for implementing a strategy aimed at developing and optimizing a company's interactions with its customers.

patterns: what about the advantage of the Customer Relationship Management
responses:
manage customer contacts 
 manage marketing campaigns 
 manage customer service through responsive support,

patterns: what about  the Entreprise Resource Planning
responses: An ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning in English) is software that looks like a large platform centralizing the tools for managing the main functions of a company: production, sales, purchasing, storage, delivery, customer relations, accounting , business management,

patterns: what about  the challenges of Entreprise Resource Planning
responses:
Improve customer satisfaction 
 Lower the costs 
 Reduce your deadlines

patterns: are there any problems with the supply chain management
responses:
Lack of Traceability 
 Lower the costs 
 Verification process

patterns: what is the problem of traceability
responses: Some supply chains suffer from opacity and a lack transparency in their processes. This lack of vision on the quality or origin of the materials or products is a defect that the big brands seek to correct given the the negative impact this can have on their image.

patterns: what is the problem of fraud and counterfeiting
responses: The supply chain also has negative aspects for the company from a financial point of view, since it can example losing substantial sums of money through it.

patterns: what is the problem of Verification process
responses: The number of actors and transactions involved in the supply chain is considerable, consequently slowing down the processes and increasing the risk of losses or errors.

patterns: is there a solution for this problem
responses: blockchain

patterns: you can give me a brief definition of blockchain
responses: is an information storage and transmission technology that is transparent, secure, and operates without a central control body

patterns: what are the solutions offered by the blockchain
responses:
transparency 
 Significant time and cost reduction 
 Security of supplies 
 streamlining the buying process
a blockchain register distributed between its actors makes it possible to identify the source of the loss, theft or fraud, thus ensuring better overall control.

patterns: what is Significant time and cost reduction
responses: The elimination of so-called 'trusted' intermediate parties also reinforces this reduction in costs and delays.

patterns: how to apply Security of Supply
responses: To secure its supply quickly and easily, it would suffice to apply a label to a product,  register it on the blockchain respecting the following data

patterns: how we apply Automation and fluidification of the purchasing process
responses: On the blockchain, smart-contracts can be built. When the conditions chosen by the different parties are met, these smart contracts automatically execute their terms and conditions for invoicing, deliveries, payment validations.

patterns: what is the future of blockchain in the supply chain
responses: Although it is still a technology under development and must prove itself, the supply chain will be a privileged field of application, hence the need for supply managers to master the subject in depth.

patterns: how to introduce a blockchain solution in the supply chain
responses:
Choose your platform 
 Initialize the Blockchain 
 Implement smart contracts 
 Choose your consensus protocol

A smart contract is a self executing contract with the terms of the agreement between buyer and seller being directly written into lines of code. The code and the agreements contained therein exist across a distributed, decentralized blockchain network.

patterns: what does cohu say about the scm
responses: We didn't want partnership relationships with third-party products, and if you look at who is leading the push in the cloud, it's Oracle.

patterns: what does Bissell say about the scm
responses: When we chose Oracle's cloud-based platform, we got something to help transform our business. The solutions are fully functional and updated quarterly. If you're worried about where they are today, they're ready. And they will improve tomorrow.

patterns: what does FedEx say about the scm
responses: The Oracle Analytics tools allow us to drill into the operations on an almost real-time basis and see what is going on and evaluate how things are developing worldwide.

patterns: and what is dp world feedbak when working with scm
responses: We were able to run the whole  operation without anybody in the office. We never thought we'd be able to run the company without employees onsite.

patterns: what is the relationship between scm and industry 4.0
responses: Industry 4.0 SCM also offers a significant advantage over traditional SCM, as it enables aligned planning and execution while driving substantial cost savings.
Smart SCM solutions can help you meet customer demand and financial goals at the same time.
it can free up supply chain employees to contribute to the company in such a way as to produce more added value.

patterns: the relationship between the customer and supply chain management
responses: SCM has always been about increasing efficiency and reducing costs. These needs have not changed. On the other hand, what has changed is that the customer now plays a resolutely central role in defining the priorities of the SCM. It has been said that customer experiences live and die in the supply chain.

chain logistique correspond a la gestion des flux de marchandises, de donnees et de finances associes Ã  un produit ou service, de l'approvisionnement en matieres premieres  et a la livraison du produit a sa destination finale.

patterns: quel est la difference entre chain d'approvisionnement et la chain logistique
responses: La supply chain est trop souvent reduite a la seule logistique. Et bien que certains pensent que supply chain = chaine logistique, il n'en est rien. En effet, la logistique est une composante du SCM mais n'est pas son entierete. La supply represente une chaine globale et des fonctions qui ne sont pas de la logistique .
